- **RTX 3070 (Debian Server)**: Always-on control plane + small models (7B-8B)
- **RTX 3090 (Windows Gaming PC)**: Warm burst compute + big models (32B), gaming-gated

- Intelligent routing (small vs big requests)
- Gaming-aware gating (NORMAL/GAMING modes)
- Force-big override signals
- Fail-soft to 3070 if 3090 unavailable

## Core Principles
1. Gaming and LLM inference are incompatible when sharing GPU
2. Stability and determinism beat utilization
3. Routing must be explicit and auditable

description:
Build the central router service that handles all LLM requests.

- OpenAI-compatible API endpoint (single entrypoint)
- Routing logic (small model vs big model)
- Mode endpoint querying (check Windows NORMAL/GAMING)
- Force-big signal detection (header, model name, prompt tag)
- Health checks for both backends
- Fail-soft logic (fallback to 3070)

## API Design
- `/v1/chat/completions` - Main chat endpoint
- `/v1/models` - List available models
- `/health` - Health check

## Routing Logic
1. Check force-big signals → route to 3090 if healthy
2. Query Windows mode endpoint
3. If GAMING → route to 3070
4. If NORMAL + heavy request → route to 3090
5. If 3090 unhealthy → fail-soft to 3070

title: Deploy Chatterbox Turbo TTS service on Debian server
description:
Set up Chatterbox Turbo voice synthesis service on RTX 3070.

## Model Specification
- **Model**: Chatterbox Turbo (ResembleAI)
- **Parameters**: ~350M
- **VRAM**: Minimal (~1-2 GB)
- **Type**: Voice-cloning TTS
- **Co-hosted with**: Qwen3-Coder-7B on RTX 3070

## Service Architecture
FastAPI service exposing HTTP /tts endpoint:
- Accepts: text + reference audio clip
- Returns: audio/wav
- Model loaded once at startup

## Critical Constraints
- **Python 3.11 only** (PyTorch incompatible with 3.13)
- Requires HuggingFace authentication
- huggingface-hub>=0.23.2,<1.0 required

## Reference Audio Requirements
- Duration: 5-10 seconds
- Format: WAV, 16 kHz mono
- Content: Natural speech, single speaker

## Tasks
- [ ] Set up Python 3.11 virtualenv
- [ ] Install dependencies (torch, torchaudio, fastapi, chatterbox-tts)
- [ ] Configure HuggingFace authentication
- [ ] Create FastAPI TTS service
- [ ] Create/record reference audio clip
- [ ] Test TTS generation
- [ ] Containerize service (Docker)
- [ ] Integrate with router for agent responses

## Scheduling Rule
Serialize TTS after LLM inference - never run concurrently to avoid GPU contention.
